messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/auth.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\CommentController::destroy` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/comments/{comment}`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/auth.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\\Http\\Controllers\\CommentController::destroy`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files containing the implementation of App\Http\Controllers\CommentController::destroy

- app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php

Explanation
- I searched the codebase for CommentController classes. There are three controller classes named CommentController (namespaced differently): 
  - app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php (namespace App\Http\Controllers)
  - app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php (namespace App\Http\Controllers\Admin)
  - app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController.php (namespace App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1)
- The route in routes/auth.php imports App\Http\Controllers\CommentController and registers the resource routes for comments (only store and destroy). That corresponds to the file listed above: app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php.
- That file contains the destroy(Comment $comment) implementation which authorizes the action, deletes the comment, and returns the Turbo Streams response updating/removing comment elements and the comments count. The other two files are different classes (different namespaces) and are not the controller referenced by routes/auth.php, so they do not match the fully-qualified name App\Http\Controllers\CommentController::destroy.
